page.title: 02Mining in SW Hamilton
page.content: For many years Hamilton was heavily dependant on coal mining and the Duke derived a lot of revenue from it. After 1850 various companies leased the miners and developed them further by sinking shafts well outside Hamilton. {COLLIERY CLOSURES The Collieries in our area were abandoned before the war with Earnock and Eddlewood Pits closing in 1932 and Cadzow in 1937. Mining switched to the lower parts of the seams beside the Clyde and was finally closed in 1950. {EFFECTS OF COLLIERY CLOSURES { }The first effect was the transfer of workers to Fife. However, the loss of employment in the area has not been made up by newer industries. The local authority then had the opportunity to demolish the{miners' {rows }and rehouse their tenants.
